description: A natural compound known for its anti-inflammatory effects, investigated for its impact on signaling pathways related to apoptosis.
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease characterized by inflammation of the colon and rectum.
A signaling pathway involved in the regulation of immune response and cell survival, with components including IKK, IKB, and NF-kB.
An active form of caspase-3, involved in the execution of apoptosis.
An active form of caspase-9, an initiator caspase in the apoptosis pathway.
A family of proteins that regulate apoptosis, where Bcl-2 is anti-apoptotic and Bax is pro-apoptotic.
Cytochrome c, a protein involved in the electron transport chain and apoptosis.
A subunit of the NF-kB transcription factor, involved in the regulation of immune responses.
Phosphorylated and non-phosphorylated forms of IKKβ, a kinase involved in the NF-kB signaling pathway.
Phosphorylated and non-phosphorylated forms of IKBα, an inhibitor of NF-kB signaling.
